import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react' import { connect } from 'react-redux' import { fetchingData, fetchingUserDetails } from '../redux/ReducerComponents/User/Action' import './Main.css' function Main({ userData, fetchingData, fetchingUserDetails }) { useEffect(async () => { await fetchingData() }, []) const readData = (id) => { fetchingUserDetails(id) } return (
{ userData?.loading == true ?

Loading...

: userData?.error ?

{userData?.error}

: userData?.users?.length > 1 ? ( userData?.users?.map((user) => { return (

{user?.name}

readData(user?.id)}>Read

Edit

handleDelete(user?.id)}>Delete

) }) ) : ( userData?.users?.map((value) => { return (

Name

{value?.name}

Username

{value?.username}

Email

{value?.email}

Phone

{value?.phone}

Address

{value?.address?.street}, {value?.address?.city}

Zip Code

{value?.address?.zipcode}

Back

) }) ) }
) } const mapStateToProps = state => { console.log("mapStateToProps", state.user) return { userData: state?.user } } const mapDispatchToProps = dispatch => { return { fetchingData: () => dispatch(fetchingData()), fetchingUserDetails: (id) => dispatch(fetchingUserDetails(id)) } } export default connect(mapStateToProps, mapDispatchToProps)(Main)
